intro: Brachynema ferruginea, commonly known as the rust-hair plant, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are typically grouped in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs, giving it its common name. Brachynema ferruginea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
